programme.title: Travel Man
programme.sub-title: Travel Man - Oslo with Fay Ripley
programme.desc: Richard is joined by actor Fay Ripley for a wintry mini-break in Oslo. Together they pack two days with sledging, screaming, skiing, sculpture and scoff.

programme.title: Travel Man
programme.sub-title: Travel Man - Zurich
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade delivers the definitive guide to a 48 hours mini-break in Switzerland's largest city, Zurich. Joining him for fondue, hot chocolate, Dada, footie, and a ride on the steepest funicular railway in the world is Frank Skinner.

programme.title: Travel Man
programme.sub-title: Travel Man - Ibiza
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade and comic actor Jessica Knappett tour the White Isle of the Med where they spend 48 hours. They take in some alfresco art, deluxe cocktails, an exclusive supper club and a hippy gong bath.

programme.title: Travel Man
programme.sub-title: Travel Man - Ljubljana
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade is joined by comedy titan Eddie Izzard for two days in Slovenia. The fun starts in the capital Ljubljana and the duo experience local tapas, orange wine, and a trip to the stunningly beautiful Lake Bled.

programme.title: Travel Man
programme.sub-title: Travel Man - Milan
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade and comedian Morgana Robinson tour a sweltering Milan. Together they criss-cross the city, taking in paintings, a musical pasta-making lesson, and a drink in the smallest bar in the world.

programme.title: Travel Man
programme.sub-title: Travel Man - Christmas Special: 96 Hours In Jordan
programme.desc: In this Christmas special, Richard takes comedian and children's author, David Baddiel, on a four-day trip to Jordan. They visit Jordan's capital, Amman, reenact a train raid in Hollywood's favorite desert, feast with the Bedouins, fly a gyrocopter, stay at the smallest hotel in the world, visit the ancient city of Petra, learn how to cook the local Christmas specialty, and buy the three things gifted to baby Jesus by the three Wise Man.

programme.title: Travel Man
programme.sub-title: Travel Man - Athens
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade is back on his mini-break travels. Comedy goddess Dawn French joins him in Athens for some ancient history, doughnuts, molecular food, ouzo, and a radical pedicure.

programme.title: Travel Man
programme.sub-title: Travel Man - Porto
programme.desc: Nish Kumar joins Richard Ayoade for a potter round Porto. Their hectic mini-break includes scooters, a tipple or two, a fat sandwich, pastries, confession and amazing views around the area.

programme.title: Travel Man
programme.sub-title: Travel Man - Tallinn
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade's joined by Alice Levine - DJ, broadcaster, podcaster - as the pair go on a rapid fling round Estonian capital Tallinn and all of the city's most see-able sights. Including eating at its top restaurant and visiting an old KGB outpost.

programme.title: Travel Man
programme.sub-title: Travel Man - Hamburg
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade and Bob Mortimer go for a spin round the cosmopolitan city of Hamburg. There is a Beatles tour in the red-light district, some local hash - corned beef - and hip cocktails.

programme.title: Travel Man
programme.sub-title: Travel Man - 48 hours in Dubrovnik
programme.desc: Back for his final outing as the Travel Man, Richard Ayoade dashes to Dubrovnik with comedy colossus Stephen Merchant.

programme.title: Travel Man
programme.sub-title: Travel Man - Bergen
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade is joined by comedian Lou Sanders for a two-day blast around Bergen. They explore the mountains and fjords that surround it, as well as sampling the best that this Norwegian city has to offer.

programme.title: Travel Man
programme.sub-title: Travel Man S10 E01 - 48 hours in Basque Country
programme.desc: Travel Man is back, with new host Joe Lycett presenting the definitive guide to 48 hours away in some of the most exciting short to medium haul destinations on Earth. For the first trip of his debut series, Joe is joined by comedian James Acaster for a long weekend in the Spanish part of the Basque Country, where they visit a bargain two cities for the price of one!

programme.title: Travel Man
programme.sub-title: Travel Man S10 E02 - 48 hours in Split
programme.desc: Joe Lycett presents the definitive guide to a fast and funny 48 hours away. This week he visits the Croatian City of Split with comedian, actress and writer, Aisling Bea.

programme.title: Travel Man
programme.sub-title: Travel Man S10 E03 - 48 hours in Cyprus
programme.desc: This week, Joe Lycett takes his wanderlust to Cyprus with comedian Mo Gilligan.

programme.title: Travel Man
programme.sub-title: Travel Man S10 E04 - 48 hours in Antwerp
programme.desc: Joe Lycett presents the definitive guide to a fast and funny 48 hours away. This week actor Katherine Parkinson joins Joe to explore the Belgian city of Antwerp.

programme.title: Travel Man
programme.sub-title: Travel Man S11 E01 - 48 hours in Vilnius
programme.desc: Joe Lycett is back with the definitive guide to 48 hours away in some of the most exciting short to medium haul destinations on Earth. In this first episode, comic Sarah Millican joins Joe for a fast and funny exploration of the Lithuanian capital, Vilnius.

programme.title: Travel Man
programme.sub-title: Travel Man S11 E02 - 48 hours in Dublin
programme.desc: Joe Lycett presents another definitive guide to a fast and funny 48 hours away in Dublin, with comedian, Mawaan Rizwan, for two days of statues, swimming and swigging stout.

programme.title: Travel Man
programme.sub-title: Travel Man S11 E03 - 48 hours in Salzburg
programme.desc: This week Joe Lycett heads to the Austro-German border with Roisin Conaty, as they spend 48 hours in the fairy-tale city of Salzburg.

programme.title: Travel Man
programme.sub-title: Travel Man S11 E04 - 48 hours in Marseille
programme.desc: Comedian, writer and actor Asim Chaudhry joins Joe Lycett to spend le weekend in Marseille, France’s oldest and sunniest city.

programme.title: Travel Man
programme.sub-title: Travel Man S11 E05 - 96 Hours in Rio
programme.desc: Joe Lycett jets to Brazil to present the definitive guide to how to spend 96 hours in Rio De Janeiro. Joining him on this supersized seasonal minibreak is the actor, comedian, presenter and author, Stephen Mangan.

programme.title: Alan Cummings: Paradise Homes
programme.sub-title: Alan Cummings: Paradise Homes - Norfolk and Ontario
programme.desc: Alan takes to the water of the Norfolk Broads, where he meets a family who have created their paradise home in a beautifully serene setting by the water. There is more than meets the eye as he discovers the treacherous pike and quicksand close by, learning that practicality is also important in creating paradise! He then dives into the Canadian wilderness to visit an old cabin-converted magical woodland playground. But will he be able to avoid the grizzly bears on his own quest for paradise?

programme.title: Alan Cummings: Paradise Homes
programme.sub-title: Alan Cummings: Paradise Homes - Sweden and France
programme.desc: Alan journeys to a unique farmhouse-converted mini chateau hidden in the luscious French countryside. Struck by its unusually zen and minimal interiors, Alan is taken out of his comfort zone as his conventional idea of paradise is challenged. He then ventures to the edge of the Baltic Sea to meet a family who have created an incredible getaway home made up of open and airy naturalistic structures on a tiny Swedish island, including an outdoor shower and a garden sauna experience!

programme.title: Alan Cummings: Paradise Homes
programme.sub-title: Alan Cummings: Paradise Homes - Mull and Sicily
programme.desc: On a journey back to his rugged roots of the Scottish Highlands, Alan experiences an extraordinary hidden getaway living in harmony with ancient land, complete with 360 views and golden eagles circling the property. In Sicily, Alan tours an eccentric family home built above a cave, filled with innovative and intricate space-saving details, including a one-of-a-kind bedroom climbing wall!

programme.title: Alan Cummings: Paradise Homes
programme.sub-title: Alan Cummings: Paradise Homes - Liguria and NI
programme.desc: Alan treks up Northwest coast of Italy, where a seamless subterranean villa is camouflaged into the scenic Ligurian hills overlooking the tranquil Rivera. With an unexpected abundance of luxurious living space, interior patios filled with lush greenery match the breath-taking views of the outdoors. Next, heading southwest via tractor to the Dromara Hills of Ireland, Alan explores a sleek matte-black modern barn which elegantly fuses both modern and traditional farm styles. With windows the size of walls, this farmhouse provides shelter that doesn’t exclude but enhances the experience of nature.

programme.title: Alan Cummings: Paradise Homes
programme.sub-title: Alan Cummings: Paradise Homes - Vancouver, Denmark and Norway
programme.desc: Starting a short distance from Vancouver Island, British Columbia, Alan ventures into a remarkable fantasy waterside retreat, big enough to house multiple generations of family. With intricate use of sustainable materials, the property is showered in tranquil light with nature is weaved throughout. Just outside of Copenhagen, a sun-soaked property is made up of endless windows, delicately decorated with stylish Scandi minimalism. Arriving by kayak, Alan’s final destination is a seemingly floating villa, curved around the edges and designed for ultimate tranquil relaxation

programme.title: Alan Cummings: Paradise Homes
programme.sub-title: Alan Cummings: Paradise Homes - Norfolk and Ontario
programme.desc: Alan takes to the water of the Norfolk Broads, where he meets a family who have created their paradise home in a beautifully serene setting by the water. There is more than meets the eye as he discovers the treacherous pike and quicksand close by, learning that practicality is also important in creating paradise! He then dives into the Canadian wilderness to visit an old cabin-converted magical woodland playground. But will he be able to avoid the grizzly bears on his own quest for paradise?

programme.title: Wildest Places
programme.sub-title: Wildest Places S01 E01 - Bays
programme.desc: The calm azure waters of the Coral Triangle are fringed with jungle, coconut trees and mangroves. Centuries of seismic activity have lined these bays with volcanic ash and mud. Rather than smothering life, these ‘muck zones’ have borne some of the marine world’s most bizarre adaptations.

programme.title: Wildest Places
programme.sub-title: Wildest Places S01 E02 - Reefs
programme.desc: This episode looks at the various habitats and areas of a coral reef, and how each zone within this extremely complex and delicately balanced ecosystem houses life forms that adapt in unique ways.

programme.title: Wildest Places
programme.sub-title: Wildest Places S01 E03 - Barrier Reefs
programme.desc: Off the east coast of Australia lies the world’s largest living structure – the Great Barrier Reef, which is home to curious residents and seasonal visitors.

programme.title: Wildest Places
programme.sub-title: Wildest Places S01 E04 - Islands
programme.desc: There are 25,000 islands in the vast Pacific Ocean. From palm-lined pristine white beaches to cold rocky outcrops, each one fosters its own ecology with unique rules and behaviours.

programme.title: Wildest Places
programme.sub-title: Wildest Places S02 E01 - Currents
programme.desc: Hundreds of millions of years of volcanic activity, isolation and powerful currents have shaped Antarctica and its surrounding islands into varied and fascinating terrains.

programme.title: Wildest Places
programme.sub-title: Wildest Places S02 E02 - Seasons
programme.desc: Every animal in Antarctica answers the call of the seasons, and the continent itself is vastly different in Summer and Winter.

programme.title: Wildest Places
programme.sub-title: Wildest Places S02 E03 - Connected Continents
programme.desc: Antarctica was once the centre of the ancient southern supercontinent, Gondwana. Traces of these connections remain throughout the southern hemisphere today: in plants and marine species with similarities that have long-ago changed and adapted to the environment around them.
